results.title: Sky rider
results.creator_credit: John Halas, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: An animated satire on space travel, with a central character representing “the man in the street” who takes his rocket to a galaxy and to satellites, well ahead of the Russian and American astronauts. The various forms of simple animation used in this film would provide an excellent motivation for students of animation techniques. Suitable for middle and upper primary level.

results.title: Sunshine and shadows: seventy years of Australian cinema
results.brief_description: Jack Thompson examines the evolution of Australian cinema from the isolated production of “The True Story of the Kelly Gang” in 1906 to the increasingly confident films of the 1970s. Seventy years of triumph, heartbreak, frustration, hopes, fears and success. With the aid of film clips, this documentary also looks at various themes and attitudes expressed in the films of this period. Written by David Stratten. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The early films of Hans Richter = Ghosts before breakfast
results.brief_description: This surrealist experimental film was made in 1927 by artist-painter Hans Richter. The nazis destroyed the sound version of this film and classified it as “degenerate art”. The film shows everyday objects rebelling against their daily routine.

results.title: Palette of glass
results.brief_description: Shows the creation of a set of stained glass windows for the Art Institute of Chicago, tracing the project from design to installation. Illustrates the fascinating collaboration between the artist, Marc Chagall, and the glass-maker to produce such wonderful designs. Spoken in English and French (with English subtitles). Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Juggling movie
results.creator_credit: Patrick Melly and Little Red Filmhouse
results.brief_description: Shows three jugglers instructing children in the skills of juggling and then performing a comic juggling routine in front of an audience. Features the Pickle Family Jugglers (Larry Pisoni, Peggy Snider, Cecil McKinnon). Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Next door
results.brief_description: Based on a Kurt Vonnegut Jr story. A young boy left home alone while his parents attend a movie overhears an argument bvetween the couple in the house next door. The boy, becoming increasingly disturbed by the dispute, intervenes in an unusual way. Starring James Wood as the father of the young boy.

results.title: A Child's visit to the dentist
results.brief_description: Designed to allay children’s fear of the dentist and all that dentists represent, by following a five-fear-old on her first visit to the dentist. Outlines the function of various people working in the surgery, as well as explaining the purposes of X-ray machines, drills, scrapers, etc.

results.title: Competitive swimming: starts, turns, stroke drills
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the correct form for all swimming starts - grab start for freestyle, breaststroke and butterfly; correct entry for freestyle, butterfly and breaststroke; relay starts and the backstroke start for both long and short courses. Illustrates all turns, using slow motion and underwater camera, and also shows progressive drills for all strokes.

Illustrates all turns, using slow motion and underwater camera, and also shows progressive drills for all strokes.

results.title: The Death of trees: Eucalyptus dieback
results.brief_description: All over Australia trees are dying for reasons not fully understood. Scientists have termed this phenomenon “dieback”. Within Australia a microscopic fungi and certain insects have been isolated as the cause of the massive destruction of jarrah, New England and eucalypt forests. Scientists are now looking at cloning techniques as a method of breeding trees that are genetically resistant to dieback.

results.title: Water management
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders, Peter Dimond and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Comic dramatisation is used to stress the importance of water conservation. Studies Adelaide’s water supply system to explain how and why water should be conserved. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
